intro: Launaea elliotiana, commonly known as Elliot's spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Launaea elliotiana is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, storing water in its thick stems and leaves.
